alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bath (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:58PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Alleghany and northwestern Bath Counties in west central Virginia, central Greenbrier and northern Summers Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 1230 AM EDT... At 1157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles west of Marlinton to near Frankford to near Twin Falls State Park. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewisburg... Hinton... Renick... Neola... Sandstone... Falling Spring... and Asbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
